title: Milan! Athens! Halifax! Canada's athletes span globe over weekend
text:
Kelly Olynyk travels to Italy in athlete weekend round up Olympic hopefuls travel far and wide on #RoadtoRio By Jacqueline Doorey, CBC Sports Posted: Oct 05, 2015 5:20 PM ET Last Updated: Oct 05, 2015 5:36 PM ET Kelly Olynyk, Mike Riddle and Benoit Huot are tweeting from different events and vacations all over the globe. (Twitter) Related Stories 
Come next summer, Canada's top summer athletes will all be found in a single location: Rio de Janeiro. 
For now, however, they're training, competing â€” even serving up pancakes â€” in cities around the world. 
First stop: M ilan, Italy. That's where Team Canada's centre Kelly Olynyk will compete at the NBA Global Games. Olynyk's NBA team travelled to Italy for pre-season game versus Olimpia Milano on Oct. 6. Olynyk took part in a Junior NBA basketball clinic Friday. â€” @nbacares 
Now onto Salonika, Greece. Canadian defender Marie-Eve Nault flew out this morning to compete in the UEFA Women's Champions League with her Swedish club team KIF Ã–rebro. 
Sooo early but soo worth it!!! On our way to Greece to play Champions League!! #Michelleisawake #WCL @KIFOrebro pic.twitter.com/lkYnAMOOzl 
Athletes are travelling for vacation too. Freestyle skier Mike Riddle traded in snow for sand this weekend and enjoyed the beaches in Australia.
